Retro style seating inside for a different experience. Service is good as well. Price is reasonable. Draft beer selection is limited though. Parking in the area is difficult

mevZolPyKNSeBIXg153H-g.text: I love grabbing drinks here with friends. Really relaxing, fun atmosphere. I've enjoyed the food but wouldn't necessarily come here to get dinner. I have found it to be pretty pricey and not really worth it. Great happy hour specials.

Jo9OxRt4SU7MUF8wQOrKQA.text: I was visiting Pittsburgh for a work conference and came across Round Corner Cantina as I was walking back to my hotel. I decided to stop in and sat down at the bar where I was pleasantly greeted by a nice gentleman who may be the best bartender in the entire universe. He was this adorable guy in his early/mid 20s, I think his name was tanner! Those margaritas he made were out of this world and we had some wonderful conversation. Every person that walked in he greeted with a smile on his face and made them feel very welcome. Next time you are in Pittsburgh stop by Round Corner Cantina and ask for Tanner ;)

L8onfZiNXD8FMZSPXaSCdw.text: Really had a good experience here. Queso was absolutely delicious, and really enjoyed he salsa we had. The quesadilla was delicious and filling, and had a great sauce on top. The sangria was strong, but not too sweet. Our waiter was also kind and attentive. Overall great spot!

nq2OTcLPqbwDDnUxdQ9RZQ.text: Good place if you live close by. They are quick and also have a nice patio. The tacos were good, the burrito sampler is huge and great for sharing with a big group.

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

b6rcv5ahzJEkL0jtK8SERA.text: I love this place!!! We stopped in for a snack and went up on the outside deck and stayed for hours! The house made margaritas were great! Served in mason jars with fresh lime slices and salty rims. We started off with the queso fundido which was very tasty, great chips and spicy cheese. We then had the fries that were served liked nachos!!! Wow they were so good with fresh quac and salsa and fresh jalapenos slices. Such a cool vibe, good music great food cool atmosphere. Next time you're in Larry-vile, stop in!!  Update:   Since the last review, I we stopped in twice, first time we sat inside upstairs and was seated by the host. After sitting for over ten minutes, a waitress never showed up. Even though there three of them standing at the hostess station so, after 10 more minutes, we left. Today, we went back to sit outside on the patio on a beautiful sunny day, we walked up stairs and waited by the hostess station, after being ignored for a few minutes the host said, just go out and find a seat.  So we went out to the patio and sat along the back bar because it was the only seats open, so after sitting there for several minutes, a host came back and said rudely " we aren't really sitting people back here", "I'll have to let the waiter know" She dropped off two waters and That was the last we saw her After 5 more minutes, we got up and left. That was twice, there won't be a third. As great as a place can be, it doesn't matter if your service is terrible. We will not be back for a third time.

pMfZYm9MUKIikc8VWTOwWQ.text: Such a great patio, and good food and drinks as well. A little pricey, but worth it for the atmosphere.

Jocga1wDEtczcZClFvPKwQ.text: Yikes. I had high hopes for this place, but was disappointed in several things. This place wasn't busy for a Sunday at brunch time, but the lack of attention from our server made it seem that way. We waited a while to place our food orders and when the food came out, mine was missing. Our server asked if I had gotten food (as if she didn't take my order 15 minutes before). She politely said she'd run back and get it, but then returned to say it was almost ready. I am thinking she just forgot to put my order in as it didn't arrive until my friends were almost done with their meals.   I had the breakfast tacos which were good. A helping of rice and beans (on the smaller side) came with them. I also had 2 of the house margaritas - also on the smaller side but good.  My friends all had the French toast which they described as decent, but the bacon on the side was a big downer - very overcooked. They got potatoes on the side as well (also thought some of these were overlooked) and were surprised when they asked for ketchup and the server said they don't have any (at all, ever). Kind of odd for any restaurant that serves any type of potato I thought.   I did really enjoy their (I'm guessing) homemade tortilla chips and salsa. I would maybe give this place another shot on a different day as I'm sure their lunch and dinner options are better and maybe we were just there on an off day.

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margarita
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potatoes
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French toast and bacon

Sz_-5fEyD-45nFu7fg8O7g.text: Best place ever! I visited Pittsburgh for the Fringe Festival (no one's heard of it) and was looking for a late night bite. All of the places across the street that SAID they were open were dirty liars because they closed their kitchen 45 minutes early and couldn't even spare a cold french fry. Anyways, their loss, because I stumbled into this cantina like a cat in the rain looking for sustenance and wow it was amazing! I'm from SoCal so I know good Mexican food, and most of Pennsylvania has never even met a proper taco, but this place was super high quality and authentic and delicious. We sat on the back patio and it was beautiful out. They sat us right away. We got shrimp tacos, fish tacos, a California burrito, rice, beans, and churros. I also got a painkiller cocktail. Everything tasted super good and came quick and was reasonably priced. We loved it so much we came back the next day, and I think I might have to move here. It blew every other restaurant in town out of the water. Board up your kitchen and just come here every day!

bqrstzOQ-QPKHrTBikRbXw.text: Not the best food in town but definitely a cute little place worth checking out. There's multiple areas to sit including the bar, a section of tables and booths, and an outdoor patio. It definitely gives off a vibe that it's a good place to just come and hang out with a group of friends.   The food itself isn't that spectacular. I got the carnitas tacos and I was a little disappointed. They weren't very flavorful. My friends also ordered the queso, corn, soup, and a burrito. The queso was very good and soup were very good. The corn could have used more toppings all around rather than just piling everything on top of 1 side. The burrito looked like it was going to be very good but the verde sauce on top was very dense and flavorless. Tasted nothing like verde sauce in my opinion. I also think some of the food is a little overpriced. The amount of queso you get for $8 is not much at all.   As for the drinks we go michaladas and margaritas. The michaladas I was not impressed with. I think if they added the tajin seasoning as a rim it could be a lot better. The margaritas I wasn't all that impressed with either. They were good but they also had a weird taste.   Ambiance: 4 Food/Drink quality: 3 Presentation: 3 Price: 3 Overall: 3

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Indoor dining area
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chips and salsa
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Michalada

fxVZEQdWraB6BmOVRqC3aw.text: Phenomenal. This was one of the best restaurants I've been to in Pittsburgh. The food was delicious, the service was relatively fast for how busy it was, and the waitress was nice. Highly recommended. I loved the nachos and the carne asada and Mahi Mahi tacos! The macho mango margarita was delicious as well. Couldn't leave without having churros for dessert, which were perfectly crisp and served with syrup

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carne asada fries
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp, beef brisket, carne asada, and mahi mahi tacos
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos

AxXbY9xO9642X3hv7k3_OA.text: I came here again recently and wanted to update my review. The service wasn't that great and the food wasn't memorable. I am still reviewing them with an "a-ok" rating, because it just wasn't that memorable or special at all. Their margaritas are tasty, the location is good and their outdoor patio is wonderful, but I just don't love their food or their service. Maybe the third time will be a charm?

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Traditional Margarita- can&#39;t go wrong.

rKvJ-txAmt_NDjzurEA6Uw.text: Greay place for food. A few buddies and I went here for my birthday and like all good buddies do they bought me a few shots. After we took the 3rd shot, the bartender said we had to "slow it down". I understand if we were 21 and ripping shots back to back but these were casual over an hour span. Again, great food but maybe the staff should understand how to interact with their clients.

dHNzZdg1f80JHT031AsL6w.text: Very satisfied with the environment. Went on a a weekend date here. Marg's were grand and so was the street corn! Little crowded at the front due to space. Prices comparable to other Pitt taco restaurants.

FkdKb1HNgyx5LWKTlnLSMA.text: Quick stop here on our way day drinking in the strip with friends. Hubs and I got two drinks off the specialty drink menu. Both excellent with a nice presentation. Got their chips and salsa, thick homemade chips and a nice fresh salsa. Not the type you find in a chain. It was pureed, great spiced tomato flavor. We also got the potato tacos, presentation was awesome and the flavors were a nice change of pace. Wished we had more time to hang but we will just do that another day. Will be back.

61QJKXm9X6nWFNbSiKSxXA.text: Truly outstanding. Food was superb. Everyone in our party had a different entree and we all were very pleased (I had the Carne Asada Campechano which was great). For drinks we had the Jai Alai and the Doctors Orders, both of which were creative, well made, and very tasty. The waitstaff were all upbeat and well-informed. The ambiance was very cool. We will be back!

gAFu-hp8edN6Ohff6KF_jw.text: This was the 3rd time I was here. The service this time was actually good. That's surprising because the last two times the service was appalling. It was so bad the second time the server gave me free guacamole & apologized for her awful service.  The only reason we went back was the food is very good. Last time I had the chorizo tacos & they were delicious. This time I had carne Asada & they were also very good. My husband had carnitas (pork) & he really enjoyed them too. I tried the house margarita & it was terrible. The taste was disgusting. Not sure what their other drinks are like.  In the past they had elote (Mexican street corn), but no longer have it. Too bad! It was delicious.  The guacamole is expensive, but delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. House margarita that was just awful. Don&#39;t waste your money.
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork carnitas tacos that melt in your mouth.
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious carne Asada tacos

vWv5bGT766Z0ur4jupT4MA.text: This place is what it is. A small Mexican food joint situated in the heart of Lawrenceville with great margaritas, beautifully fried tortilla chips, and awesome guacamole. The tacos are not bad! They taste sort of like the tacos over at Bakersfield, but these are much better IMO.  Whatever it is, it is an awesome place to start off a night out, especially if you can get seats outside in the back patio. The prices are very reasonable and the food is definitely tasty (not earth shattering mind blowing Mexican food), but it does the trick. Think savory Mexican food made fresh by the local gringo on santa ana boulevard in California who probably spent his days surfing in Baja, dated a Oaxacan senorita, and learned how to cook up some good classic tex mex that anyone would find delicious and even go back for more.  Fun atmosphere, delicious bites, great margaritas, good drink selection, overall awesome place to chill out before a night out in Pittsburgh's Williamsburg.

0vcWknzdaXeOEIkCO7NshA.text: Are you looking for a small spot with a unique hipster vibe and amazing food? Look no further my friends! This place doesn't look like much at first glance- however, it doesn't take long to realize you just struck gold. Within the first 5 min with only a sip of my margarita- I knew. The drink was authentic and clean. No cheap syrups or unnecessary ingredients. The service was quick and friendly- literally what more could you ask for? And the food- just wow. It's not a big place, but the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. You've got to go experience this place for yourself. If you appreciate quality authentic Mexican food- you will not regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hrJwizSHYRZjDbXGsCeVLQ.text: I'm in nacho heaven! The portion is massive and delicious! Everything tastes fresh. So good. Also got churros which were delicious and the perfect crunchy-on-the-outside-chewy-on-the-inside texture. Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I already ate one, but a delicious order of churros
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Will definitely order the nachos again

KesSuPK_akq4LO1nAQEC4w.text: Round Corner Cantina gets a 5-star rating for having some really awesome decor, but the service and food is truly lacking. I ordered what sounded like would be a delicious quesadilla and salsa and chips. The quesadilla lacked flavor which was the opposite of what I expected given the description, and the salsa had no spice or excitement to be found. Overall, I spent $18 on a small meal that was delivered by a rude server.   I don't have a desire to come back here. Food options for me are particularly limited, and I am not a drinker. I've heard people comment that their alcoholic bevs are fantastic, so if that's your thing - try for yourself.   Warning: it gets loud, crowded, and intense pretty quickly! Again, if that's your scene, you will probably LOVE Round Corner Cantina.   My favorite thing about the place was learning about the Round Corner Hotel history.

1CnuAGQvzid86Lhq-aDIwA.text: Round Corner has always gotten mixed reviews when I've brought it up in conversation. I would be lying if I said that I've heard too many good comments regarding the food. I've always loved their bloody marias but only recently tried the food.  A friend and I went the other week for brunch and the menu seemed interesting enough. I ordered French toast with a chipotle butter and ancho syrup. Overall, it wasn't bad. I never order sweet breakfast food but the chipotle and ancho balanced out the sweetness of the toast. I do gave a few gripes about the meal though. The amount of butter given saturated the toast so much so that half way through, I couldn't bring myself to finish the meal. The meal also was just French toast. It didn't feel complete. I understand that some places are a la carte but my friend ordered the hash and his order seemed a lot more complete. It was more than enough food for me but it just would have felt like more of a meal if it had maybe a slice less and maybe a compote of sorts. I will go back but maybe just stick to the drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French toast with chipotle butter and ancho syrup

cm0WhdLqtvFl1Q-kBrUFPA.text: Atmosphere - walk through the bar and the retro-rad dining room to the fabulous out of this country fenced patio in the back.  Service - super, easy-going, nothing is a problem, welcoming.  Drinks - margaritas with fresh juice, happy hour is a must.  Food - varied taco selection mostly which are pretty good, chips and salsa and guac are fresh and mildly spiced, spicy pickled vegetables interesting and different served in a 16 oz mason jar for the table to share included pineapple and apple and celery and cucumbers.  I'll be going back. Really enjoyed for a summer night.

DXzmPFX_kXSvWwpz7KhCig.text: Great food.  Loved the various tacos and the hotdog.  The corn was fantastic too.  The lamb and beef taco was great.  I would come here again.

Ez78qG-WDAsbYouYSnhVdQ.text: Limited indoor seating. The patio was very well done. The 97 degree heat made it a bit uncomfortable.   Get chips and salsa. And the guacamole    Smaller portions.  Not entrees but easy to share smaller plates.  The pork pibil taco was as good as I have had in this country.

zWMZoQ5XZ-UxaLipJ7qniQ.text: I love Cantina's food. I mean, I really love it. I always get the pork belly tacos because nothing else matters. They have apples and radish on them. Why would I order anything else?  The drinks are pretty good, they are all REALLY strong! I wish they had more non-tequila options but oh well. Just one thing: don't order the bloody marys unless you like well vodka mixed with salsa. Luckily, if you're here for brunch most of their cocktails can double as socially acceptable day-drinking options, so avoiding the bloody marys isn't too hard.  The other thing I love about Cantina is their outdoor patio, which is the perfect summer chill spot. I'd actually give it 5 stars, if it weren't for the horrible service. I know it's a dive bar, and I'm not expecting the best restaurant experience of my life here, but the servers are seriously unhelpful and at times, just plain rude. Still, it's one of my favorite happy hour spots. Pork belly always trumps poor service, in my mind.

xr1xhp92YyuMOXmlwEVoRw.text: Excellent! I love, love, love their tacos and the complimentary chips and salsa are perfect.  Drinks are usually on the strong side, but who can complain about that?  The back patio is really charming and they seem to have spruced it up a bit (new tables, greenery, etc).  I don't even feel like I'm in Pittsburgh when I'm out there.  The food and atmosphere are super impressive.  It does get crowded late at night, though, so be prepared for that.  I prefer to go for lunch.  Oh, and I was hoping to get some tres leche cake, but unfortunately, they don't serve any desserts.  I'm still giving it 5 stars - better for my diet!

WWXluujKEg11zmeZLJSB_Q.text: I can't get enough of this place. From the stellar drinks to the kicks ass guacamole! It can get busy at times and the service will slow a bit, but not for lack of trying on the staff's behalf.  Every time I have gone (which is a lot)  the drinks a good and strong, and the food is fantastic!  I have taken both my mother and sister and they are fans!  I'll definitely continue to frequent the Cantina!!! :)

GfC90wNFtWuBpT3qqi_eyQ.text: Typical Lawrenceville - average food / poor service. What killed me was the amount of orange juice in the house margarita. The correct amount is NONE.

r2Zb6lj1-9DJPXPON3Si3g.text: New ownership of a bar that's been there for a long time.  New decor inside, same huge, great yard out back.  This place has an adventurous drink menu including standards like the Pimm's Cup as well as several margaritas with unconventional ingredients such as basil, pepper, chartreuse, hibiscus, elderflower... Charming ambience - drinks served in Mason jars, homey, hip feeling to the patio.  They are still working out a few details, including the offerings on a limited food menu, but are off to a good start.  Also worth noting is the fact that while their stated hours included a closing time of 10:00 on Sunday, they were open longer than that since many people were there.

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gE43nDuNCfPdp5MmhD4wzw.text: Never having heard of the Round Corner Cantina, my cousin took me for tacos and bowling next door. The food as fantastic. The tacos were very creative - unlike any I've had in this city. Highly recommend you give it a shot, and be adventurous when ordering.

S4p6U_szOY8tESEHXI8CAw.text: used to be better but they play games with people, not sure why such a bad attitude with customer service here, if you dont have a beard you wont be welcome i guess....  food is sub par at best, more a of a beer and move on kind of place with much  better options in this hood

qOzrUHItUkeGWzqunqMzAg.text: This place is great in the warmer months--it has an incredible garden in the back and breezy summery drinks (e.g., sweet tea and all sorts of tequila). The menu is great, even from a California/Southwest Mexican food snob perspective. And the bar is cozy in the winter. The staff is also friendly and plays good music. Atmosphere is quasi-1890's frontier.  Update: After their renovation of the backyard and staff changes, I have to say that Cantina has taken a dip in the quality of the food and service. Some of the waitstaff from the opening is still there and very good, but the newer waitresses they've hired are not as great as the original crew.  Somehow, the bar crowd also went from refreshingly hip to baby boomer in the last couple of months.

8FzboDrsNuA34Kl-_8GDcA.text: Visited the Cantina last Friday night and sat outside because it was a beautiful night. I didn't care for my one drink, Dos Esquis beer, cilantro, jalapeno and salt. The server said it was popular, but not to my taste buds. I did think they had a nice selection of drinks. I had the fish tacos........they were tasty, but not the best I have had. My friend had some chicken and potatoes dish wrapped around corn husks; however after several drinks we weren't aware you don't eat the husks!  It would have been nice for our server to fill us in on this minor detail. The chips and guacamole were excellent and the chips appeared homemade. It is small inside and pretty dark, so I recommend either going for happy hour and/or trying to sit outside.

wvFhT1WBAxYsAAKWOaBnUA.text: One of the few places in Pittsburgh with authentic latino drinks! For that crowded from wall-to-wall experience, hit them up on a weekend night. I enjoyed the tacos by day, and the fact that they actually make REAL caiprinha's here, even when it's snowing outside. Now that's an oxymoron that I love: caiprinha's in the snow..... Only in Pittsburgh!

qUQtHzXvPy16y5kK4mGRpg.text: Dropped in on this place last Saturday. Kept hearing about in via word of mouth, so grabbed the 86B and strolled down the hill.   Given neighborhood, I initially confused the place, for someone having a lively houseparty. An old head-high fence and hanging lamps with their illumination filtering through the wood beams.  The crowd is not what I call a traditional "hipster" crowd that you may encounter  a la Brillobox. More "mature" if that has any meaning nowadays. The front bar area was small, but never gave off the impression of sardine packed-in-ed-ness. What appealed to me the most is the general sociability of the place. They talk to strangers here, and while that may be tied to the people than the place, per se, it adds to it, imho.  All waitresses/servers are *amazingly* hot and friendly. Grabbed a seat. Drank two caipirinhas and a hopdevil. Packed full of kick. Mason jars, are strange to drink out of, unless you are from the south or Missouri.  I have no such problem, and it gives off a very down-to-earth air that I would expect out of Lawrenceville. Costs seem to be "midling." 6-7 bucks for some of the drinks. That is not huge to me, but may be to others.  Menu looked tasty, and had some Spanish and Mexican beers I ran into during my foreign travels.  Did not sample food menu, but will in the future.   A great jukebox, and given the sensitivity of my ears, the volume was not too too bad...for a while. Later on that night, not sure if they cut it higher or if certain albums play louder than others. It seemed less of a problem than other places in terms of sheer "blast."  There appears to be a secondary room of tables and chairs behind the front bar area, and going further to the rear of the establishment and up the hill is an intriguing grassy patio area. Did not explore that, because I'm a friendless wuss who is afraid of looking like a loser, but if you come with 5+ folk, you may want to snag a spot out there early and see what stars you may be able in amongst all the air pollution.  This is close to a 5, but I only gave 4 due to the slowness of getting served at times. It seems like there is no bar to serve clients on the rear-patio area; the two ladies in the front were very busy cranking out drinks for all, so I could not fault them for the time it took. The time was due to the crush, versus indicative of any rudeness or lack of attentiveness. If they could resolve that, or add more barstaff, I think it would tip it over into perfection.  This place has character, good service, good people, and thankfully is a work in progress.

gFQsbN7JNV2nDY5cFMOKVQ.text: terrrrrrrrrrrrrrible service. i was waiting and waiting and waiting and waiting and when my drink did come, it was horrendous! it was some hibiscus concoction, but hibiscus has flavor and this had none. and the prices are nothing to sneeze at, especially for pittsburgh.  the patio is quite cute, but the bench arrangements make it impossible to add more seating to your table. and the benches are horribly uncomfortable, even when you're not squished 3 to a bench.  but omigod this place has such potential! their exterior is one of the most alluring i've ever seen. get it together, round corner cantina!

d19db1zZXoovQow9LcqZmw.text: What a great outdoor space. That really changed the game for this place. Now not only is the food great, but the atmosphere is awesome too. They also have an outdoor bar, which is really nice, and gives the whole place a ton more space. I recently tried their tamales, and they were so good Their tacos are great, as well as everything else I've had here. Really top-notch food, and not very expensive at all. Their drink creations are also pretty great. I love me a margarita. I can't recall any really bad experiences with service, but I also have never gotten spectacular service either.

pTGw54T1gB-jj_s5AasZbA.text: I finally went back to Round Corner Cantina in honor of a dearly departed friend, who simply adored the brunches.  The Sunday Brunch is worth 4 stars: $4 Bloody Marys or Bloody Marias.  Both well-mixed and priced right.  Not too crowded.  The catch is that this place is intolerable on weekends.  Being that Butler St. only has a dozen bars, this should be a top choice for me.  But it's not.  The service is incredibly slow.  Worst than that, the server knew nothing about the drinks.  I tried to ask about the Carnation, but she had to look at the menu to see which drink I was referring to.  I ordered it anyway.  What looked to be a mix of the best attributes of my two favorite cocktails--the Cosmo and the Dark 'N Stormy--was just a heavy dose of ginger beer with a splash of mediocre vodka, a touch of cran juice, far too much lime, and way too much ice.  It was a hot night and the drink was thoroughly watered down by the time it got to me.  I'd be inclined to blame the server over the bartender, but I'm not sure.  I'm not a professional bartender, but when I serve drinks with ice on days over 80 degrees, I make specialty ice cubes with the drink ingredients to not water down the drink.  For $7, I certainly wasn't expecting my cocktail to be a third water by the time it arrived.  Finally, the food.  In a word: eh.  I thought both of the pork tacos were all right.  But the pollo tinga was downright awful.  Chicken in all varieties is one of my food staples, but something unholy was done to this poultry.  The guac was decent, but honestly Mad Mex has better...and if you're claiming to be authentic Mexican anything, Mad Mex should not best you on any detail.  To top it off, they charge $3.5 for chips and salsa and then only refill the chips but not the salsa.  C'mon.

lWPrgt8Q_pJNsQppU1SbnQ.text: I've found my favorite outdoor patio in Pittsburgh! The food is super cheap and yummy.  I've been here a few times now, and I've tried the carnitas, pescado, and pollo verde tacos, all of which were good.  I'm not a huge fan of their margaritas, but nothing beats a dos equis amber with lime along with these tacos!

55OIQgFEUdTCilkyd892uA.text: Despite living in and around Lawrenceville for quite a few years, I had never been to the Cantina before last night. I had been put off by the pricey menu and the large crowds outside on the weekends, but my friend had driven in from Braddock to go to dinner and had his heart set on the Cantina so I gave it a shot.  I'll start with the good part; the food. The chips and salsa were fan-freaking-tastic. The salsa was spicy, but not overwhelmingly so and the chips were salty and super crispy. We ate two baskets of them! My friend had his old standby, the vegan tacos. They were beautiful and he seemed to enjoy them (he scarfed them down before my food even got to the table, but in his defense he was starving). I had the Papas Gratinadas (sweet potato with chipotle and queso Chihuahua) and that was just as delicious. The potatoes sure didn't look or taste like sweet potatoes, but that didn't disappoint me. Over all, our bill was manageable, but still a little rich for my blood.  Here's where this place lost me, the atmosphere. There are people for whom a place like the Cantina is great, I am not one of them. It was extremely crowded and loud, I could barely hear my friend over the music. Other than that, there was just a lot going on; between the patterned wallpaper, the fringe on the ceiling, the HUGE TV playing the strangest movie I've ever seen, the music and the constant motion around our table (it was busy, so that's not their fault), I felt like I was going crazy. I actually had no idea what I had ordered, because I couldn't concentrate on the menu, so I ordered the first thing I saw. I would come here for happy hour, but if that's how busy they are on a Wednesday night, it will probably not become a dinner favorite. Again, take this review with a grain of salt, I don't like crowds. If you don't mind the Brillobox on a Friday night, you should be fine. I, however, needed an hour and 5 cigarettes to calm the hell down.   Overall; great food, excellent service, too hip for this girl.

AUdh6VCfNgEMfwd9hXlq1A.text: Mixed bag myths busted: After reading about how rude the service was and that people are out for blood when it comes to getting a seat and   despite the fabulous food many declared never to return, my boyfriend and I  headed out to the Cantina.   It was a perfect night for the patio and after almost heading back in to get seats, the good seat/parking spot fairy sprinkled a little dust and TA-DA seats.  We ordered drinks (me tea, him beer) and chips&salsa.  Our server seemed annoyed like she was going to live up to the "rude" label that so many had attached the to service.  She turned out to be very kind and paid the right amount f attention to us.  Refills, beers general check ins are came in a timely manner.  I had the seitan tacos-very fresh, would have liked a little spice and will alter my order next time.  My boyfriend had the quesadilla de la parrilla and thought he was going to implode he enjoyed it so much.  Our server (again bustin' up the myths) informed us the quesadilla takes a bit longer to cook but that the wait was well worth it.)   Overall had a great night and would return again....in a heartbeat.  I can see the place getting negative reactions as yes it does get crowded, yes people smoke outside and yes the servers are busy and will not going hold your hand all night and/or stop and chat you up.  But it is a bar for goodness sakes!   Keep that in mind, don't take yourself too seriously and you will enjoy your night....

u8mHOiKrrGCwmhLVbGvnUQ.text: Best Mexican food in the Pittsburgh area.  This place has an ass to it. Come in through the front where the bar area is and head straight thru to the back where the large, beautiful patio is. Not sure which months the patio is open, but definitely check it out. I can't recommend anything in particular because I've loved it all. This place rocks.

csMsCHAlPFkUJBFiP1kO-w.text: So we tried to go to Piccolo Forno but the wait was 1.5 hrs so we walked across the street to Corner Cantina. We had drinks, they were awesome. We had guac and elotes, they were delish.  We each had 1 al pastor taco and my only complaint is that my tortilla broke and I had to use a fork. To give you some perspective, my husband lived in Mexico for 2 years so he's picky about Mexican food. He was satisfied.

EqMKNL-F9e5FV78CMLS4Dw.text: Way overrated! Very limited menu,  basically all you have to choose from are appetizers & tacos. They do not serve rice or any sides with your meal. Super small portions. I can't remember the last time I left a restaurant hungry, until tonight. I've had better tacos from a street vendor. Over price sangria that tasted like I was drinking watered down grape juice. Took forever to get our check. I was with a party of 6 and not one of us would return.  VERY disappointing!

qkZTSWebyENDvFgCVKbwXQ.text: Stopped in for drinks last weekend and was very pleased! I love the dark, moody feel of the place. Perfect spot to have a few drinks. The mezcal Manhattan was one of the best cocktails I've had in Pittsburgh. The classic Manhattan is one of my favorite drinks, so I wasn't sure how I would feel about one made in a Mexican restaurant with mezcal. It was delightful. Fresh and homemade ingredients made for a refreshing, but strong cocktail. The bartender gladly shook in a few extra dashes of bitters at my request.  When I ordered a beer for my second round, he actually said "are you sure I don't mind making you another Manhattan." I was very impressed by the friendly service.  Really looking forward to stopping back to try their grub, but honestly I would come back just for late night drinks. Well done, Mr. Bartender.

PHub0ciph8gZssHUEM2a_g.text: ordered the chips and salsa (we weren't asked which salsa we wanted, and the one that was brought out was completely devoid of all flavor).  ordered the california burrito, wet with salsa verde (green). the burrito (and all other food ordered) came out so quickly, it was suspicious. my french fries were replaced with enormous pieces of potatoes (this isn't a Cali burrito), possibly because they ran out of fries? but a disaster, nonetheless. best part of the meal was the Tapatio hot sauce.  the tofu tacos looked a bit unappetizing, but I didn't order or try those, so I won't comment on that.  wait on a Thursday night was around 75m - the michelada was OK, but definitely not worth the wait. service was good, people were nice, but food could use some work, especially when there is a large crowd. :)

5qR-EFJ7HBTLesk7Vs2EsQ.text: I have NEVER been here when the weather was warm enough to go out onto the fabled patio.  Am I missing something?  How awesome can a patio be?  I'm sure I'll make my way there eventually, but for now I can only imagine the wonders said outdoor patio holds.  Round Corner Cantina is pretty good indoors too.  My relationship with Round Corner Cantina is simple & pure. If I'm breathing, then I want tacos.  They have good tacos, and they'll bring tacos to my table in a friendly fashion.  They've got good cocktails, good beer, and I think they are reasonably priced.  They have fun drink specials.  I like coming here for food, I don't know if I'd come here to hang out because I feel like I'm too old for their crowd  ...although their lack of lighting could help me blend in.  In the one back room, its really dark.    So if you're on a date with someone who is not exactly a feast for the eyes, take them here.  There's tacos and it's dark.  Your situation will immediately be improved 100%.  tip:  this place is ALWAYS packed.  If you LOVE to sit during happy hour, I recommend getting here early to stake your claim to a seat.

u9q3_WFkztPg_vIpQ9m4rQ.text: Outdoor patio is a enjoyable experience--day or night! Drink menu is incredible. Great ambience & playlist. Service could be better. Overall, positive experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great outdoor bar area

1PJpnNz_TalhvEbCS3EHmw.text: One of the best back patios in Pittsburgh! I have been here on two occasions, once in the summer and last night and I definitely recommend coming here when the weather is a warm so you can sit outside. Their patio is tucked away from the street, a perfect little escape in Lawrenceville. Not to say I don't like the interior, it's artsy vibe and dim lighting are perfect for a date. The downside is there just isn't enough space, so the wait can be long if you have a larger group.  I ordered the house margarita, which are strong in the best way, but nothing amazing. I'm not a huge fan of OJ in my marge so next time I would probably try one of their micheladas. My friend had the Mexicana michelada with Dos Equis, cilantro, jalapeno, and lime. The cilantro and jalapeno combination is refreshing with a nice kick.  Their homemade tortilla chips and guac are amazing. I had the shrimp tacos - very cheesy with good cilantro and lime flavors. Their taco list is pretty extensive and I like how they focus on their specialty rather than trying to do it all. I love the overall vibe and drink selection and will definitely be back for summer nights on the back patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp tacos

TDcTWl98vgJ5O1hZPcjc-g.text: I've chosen to go here once. Usually I end up here because there is a line at Piccolo Forno across the street so I grab a drink until they call me. *side note- Round Corner Cantina should pay Piccolo Forno a royalty because every time I go to Piccolo Forno there are people at Cantina waiting to be called to Piccolo.*  Anyway, I chose to go there once to see how it is on a Friday night. I'm a shorter guy so it takes a little effort at the bar to get a drink. The bartender (a male) notices me and says "I'll be right there bud" - which I hate, no one wants to be called "bud." I'm having a conversation with a friend but I'm very obviously the next person in line and I keep making the "I need a drink" motions. Eventually the bartender returns to where we are- next in line- looks over my head, right over me, I start ordering because I think he's just busy and not making eye contact, and takes he order from the guy behind me!   I'm irritated so I say "WTF man?!" [But the words not the acronym.] "You said you were going to be "right here bud, then you take he guys behind me's order?!"   Bartender snaps his fingers and before I know it the doorman- or whoever he is- is trying to escort me out. Mind you I haven't had my first drink yet, not drunk, not even that rude. Just trying to get some service. The bartender asks me - "are you going to chill the 'F' (uses whole word) out??" I say "I have been chill but okay."   The doorman 'allows' me to stay. I order a double jack and diet- I never order doubles but I knew I had to because I didn't want to relive the aforementioned experience.  $18 jack and diet double. $18.00. Yes, eighteen.   Not going back. If you're in Lawrenceville, and not waiting to get into Piccolo Forno, you can do much much better and if you are waiting for Piccolo just go to Franktuary right next door, you'll pay less and get treated with respect.

4YewrVkT924HGiiPhVX-8w.text: I love love love this place  their Mojitos are the best!! Chips and Guacamole are also delicious I always make it a point to come here at least once or twice in the summer time! They have a super cute dining area with prettt wallpaper and im all about photos so it makes for the best setting!!

Vr2bOjhSwxEcny7AaY-glA.text: I wanted to like Round Corner Cantina. I really did. But I have to say, after my first visit here I'm not dying to come back.  Before you even enter this place you have to deal with something that isn't really their fault: parking. And navigating traffic. On Butler Street. Always a joy! Once I managed to deal with this step and actually entered Cantina I wasn't really encouraged; the music was playing too loudly for my taste in the front room and wasn't much better in their back room, which was so dark I had to wonder how people even read their menus if they sit there.   Looking for somewhere a bit quieter and brighter, my dinner companion and I headed to their outdoor patio, where we found high tables and chairs that I honestly thought I'd fall off of at some point during the meal, they were so unsteady. Fortunately that never happened, because we were right next to a part of the fence where the beams were extremely splintered - just thinking about tipping into them was painful!  Unfortunately, the service did absolutely nothing to improve my opinion of the place; I watched three tables that arrived after us get service. No one ever came to our table. After we finally flagged a waitress attending to a group a couple tables over, she said she'd grab our waitress. And we waited some more. While we waited the waitress that we flagged down went ahead and brought us some water...that came in plastic cups. I shudder to imagine just how much trash this place discards every day from these cups alone...  After finally ordering and waiting for what at least wasn't an unreasonable amount of time, I was able to enjoy a pretty tasty drink that came in a jar (they have jars for alcohol but not for your water?) but was disappointed with my pork tacos. The shells were kind of mushy and the sauce and toppings minimal; mine just didn't taste all that special. My dinner companion's fish tacos were actually better; I kind of wish we'd swapped.  I left just feeling let down. I honestly would've been happy to forgive this place's rustic look and loud music if the service and food were a bit better, but as it is I just don't see anything here that I'd want to brave the dreaded Butler street traffic again for.

1K_hbkyzvxb3-HS-HhutUA.text: I really enjoy Cantina! However, I'm not one of those people who views food as an art and the only questions I ask at restaurants are, "does this have dairy in it" and "where are your restrooms?" So I'm not great at critiquing like other users are.  I will say that the drinks are fantastic. I love the Michelada drinks which are just Bloody Mary's made with beer. Yum! I also am a fan of their Sangria & Margaritas.  Their fresh tortilla chips are on point, you guys - especially when they are right out of the fryer. Their guac is so green and delicious. It's different than the usual restaurant guacamole - avocado, cilantro, like and big slices of jalapeno.   Admittedly, I've only gotten tacos once there as I usually live off of chips, guac, and a drink. Their taco salad is pretty delicious if I do say so myself.  They have a great brunch. I am in love with their deep fried French Toast that is the perfect combination of sweet and spicy.  The atmosphere is really neat. There are two different and unique seating areas in the building, and then an amazing back patio. The back patio is such a fun place to sit around and catch up with friends. It's right down the street from me, so it's pretty much a weekly destination spot for me.  My only issue is that the staff can come off disinterested sometimes. I even read some of their responses on Facebook from management and, as a Social Media Manager, bad replies really stress me out. Obviously, this won't stop me from going there, but I do think finding better staff is something they could work on.

mL2lfnFBrqeoRpytaEDHuw.text: This is a yuppie hellhole, offensive cologne, fake tans, and salmon-colored shorts abound. The bartenders were unfriendly, my mojito was uninspired, and the fake Mexican food was sub par. Yet another False Mexican restaurant in Pittsburgh congrats. The only redeeming thing about this place is Edgar Um. Bring back Sufaks!jbj

BQSqN-qWInh2UeeC01Q0Zw.text: Average. Not authentic Mexican food but not creative either. Nice atmosphere & good service. Many other outstanding restaurants in this area. Disappointed.

VTPupJucT_AbXO-Izmz_jw.text: I've been going to Round Corner occasionally for drinks since earlier this year (love the Bloody Maria), but only just got around to trying the food yesterday.   My friend and I went for Sunday brunch shortly after they opened (11AM), and had no trouble grabbing seats right away at the bar. We started, of course, with Bloody Marias while looking over the menu--they're on special for $4 during brunch hours, which is a great deal.   I eventually settled on the Brisket Hash. I love savory breakfasts and this seemed like a solid choice. The dish consisted of soft, salty potatoes topped with tender and flavorful brisket, bacon, a fried egg, onions, and cilantro. I added a dash of hot sauce for some spice, but overall the dish was packed with flavor. The portion size was perfect for the price ($9) and left me satisfied but not uncomfortably full as brunches so often do.   I've always been happy with the drinks here, and now that I've enjoyed the brunch, I need to make it back to try the regular menu sometime soon.

19itW5fy-hL7tebhJaMHYg.text: It is dark in here. Like really REALLY dark! Like you could make out in the corner and no one would really notice dark. Let's not be silly though, I didn't make up in there, I come to eat!   I really do enjoy this place, even if I have to feel around for the taco's on my plate because I can't see them. But this just makes me sound old. So on to the good part, the food! So good! I had the mahi mahi taco's and the pork taco's and they are exceptional! I love when they put cabbage in a taco, I know that sounds weird, but it's just so tasty with the marinade they use!   I know that Chi Chi's (RIP) trained me to expect free chips and salsa, so it's always nice to have them free. Sorry to burst the bubble, but they're four bucks a pop....BUT it is an endless basket. Which is good because it usually disappears in about 5.5 seconds. I'm also a big judge of salsa, and this salsa definitely passes the test, with just the right amount of kick!   I do LOVE the outside area! There's tons of seating and benches and it's just so great to sit out there on a nice warm summer night with a tall glass of Dos Equis! And I am SO into tequila...badly into it. So watch out, because that bill can get high when that's in the mix! You can also trip down the steps in the dark as night dining room after too many....

pYJl5suTkCKV7MmIn7pl7g.text: Holy expensive tacos Batman I will not be back.  I ordered a total of 4 tacos and a beer grand total $25.00 dollars.    My hubby had two chorizo and papas tacos and I had a two tacos that had a shrimp and cheese filling the name escapes me.  The menu boasts of house made chorizo but we could barely taste any chorizo in the tacos. There seemed to be only one shrimp cut up into 3 pieces in each of my tacos.   I watched the cook walk back and forth between the kitchen and the dining room 8 times touching everything in the dining room and sitting down with a waitress to eat chips and salsa.  Granted the NBA Dunk Contest was on the bigscreen so it's possible that he didn't want to miss out on the action.  I would expect more professionalism from a place that charged $8 for two tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. back dining room
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. beer
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp and cheese tacos

1HY5HElLJTHvSBzC7QCHUA.text: I have never written a Yelp review before, but I have also never suffered such unjust and hostile treatment at a drinking or dining establishment. The staff at Round Corner Cantina tried their very best to ruin my New Years Eve.    Despite having recently heard horror stories on Facebook about the way they are known to treat their customers, I went to Round Corner Cantina with a group of friends to ring in the New Year. We paid the hefty $20 cover charge to get in, ordered a round of drinks, and moved to the dance floor in the back bar area. We were having a great time, but after a few minutes, I was bumped and spilled my beer on the floor.  Being a responsible patron, I went looking for a staff member to tell, so that nobody would slip. I didn't see anyone in the dance floor area, so I stood in a short hallway with one door that went behind the bar, and another that went downstairs to the basement. I thought I had just seen somebody go downstairs, so I waited for a minute or two just inside the hall. Nobody came by, so I poked my head behind the bar to tell the bartender.   As he walked by, I got his attention, and told him that I had spilled a drink on the dance floor. He didn't seem to register what I'd said, immediately snapping at me that I couldn't be in the staff-only area. I apologized politely, and repeated that I just wanted to let him know I had spilled a drink, so that he could send somebody to wipe it up. He again ignored my request, responding angrily, "I don't care what you want to tell me, you can't [EXPLETIVE] be back here!" Taken aback by his unreasonably aggressive response, I turned to go back, muttering that I was trying to help, and that he didn't have to be such a d*ck about it  (note that I am an extremely non-confrontational person, but can't put up with being treated like crap for trying to do something thoughtful).  Registering my words (seemingly for the first time), he lunged through the door and grabbed me by the arm, roaring, "Did you call me a d*ck? Do you know who I am? I AM THE BARTENDER!" Without letting me get in a word of reason, he pushed me forcefully through the entire bar, and out the door, where the bouncer then insisted that I stand across the street.   Now, outside in a t-shirt in roughly 17 degree weather, I texted my friends to come out and bring my coat and sweater. Since the coat racks were overflowing, they were unable to find my things. One of my friends very politely asked the manager if I could come back just to grab my things. She didn't seem to understand his request, and when he explained the problem twice more, she became defensive, shouting, "YOU THINK YOU'RE ABOVE ME? YOU THINK YOU'RE BETTER THAN ME?"  After managing to find my coat (but not sweater), all seven of my friends left with me, having spent $140 on cover, and roughly $50 on drinks, for about 10 minutes of dancing and 30 minutes of rummaging through coats and getting yelled at by incompetent, immature, confrontational staff members. We counted down to midnight in my frigid exile across the street from the bar, and went on to enjoy the rest of our night at Brillobox -- which I wholeheartedly recommend to anyone looking for great a place to go in the area.  So please, even if you read this review and dismiss it as a drunken new years incident (which it certainly was not, the spilled drink being my first of the night) just take a look at some of the other negative reviews. You'll notice a clear pattern of people identifying the bartender and the manager particularly as real jagoffs. They are childish, combative and dense at best. How they've managed to sustain themselves this long while apparently serving pricey, mediocre fare and treating their paying customers like criminals is beyond me. Lawrenceville is one of the best places in town to have a good time on a weekend or week-night. I've had countless positive experiences there with friendly staff, good friends and good drinks. Pick any other place, but please don't help put off the imminent self-destruction of these idiots by bringing them any more of your business.

xQOUKaJ7aKmLv9wgNxXayw.text: This place is a keeper! Went early on a Saturday evening. The front bar was full, but not crowded. However, the deck was fully packed! I had two organic margaritas and an order of the Pescado(fish) tacos. The tacos were good (a little bland for my taste), and the drinks were strong!   The music they played that night was amazing, 90s rap and R&B. I don't know if people dance there, but I was ready to bust a move! The women's bathroom is set up awkwardly... You enter into a very small room with one sink, then you enter into another small room with one toilet... I hope you're not claustrophobic!   All in all it was a good time!

4KB8stdJdqrFn0mG9OojtA.text: Mmmmmm..... Tacos..... Lots of yummy tacos. Good crowd. Good drinks. Killer patio. All around neighborhood gem

Oie29bP3v3iLPlwcwMBS3g.text: Great lunch stop in Lawrenceville. My sister and I sat in the dining room. Service was very timely and attentive. We had the chips and salsa and two drinks to start. I had the seasonal sangria - very good! For my meal I ordered the lunch special - the pollo asado burrito with rice and beans. It's huge! I had enough to take home for dinner, which is what I like. Everything was very good. We will be back again.

Z7bS0x_uNVYHoIY6uBr9Gg.text: The best things about this place in my opinion are the guacamole and margarita. Both delicious! I tried the tacos which were also very good and very large. It was pretty loud inside when we went as it was too cold to sit outside. We did have a significant wait on the weekend. I will definitely be back to try the patio.

c8X9S28F5dmmN7osRvJU5g.text: I've been coming to RCC for years. My experiences were always positive. The vibe is always on point and the crowd is fun and relaxed. Today my experience was less than awesome. The outside bar tender was a bit short and rude. I asked a menu question as I was considering trying something new. Before I could finishing my sentence he cut me off with " no substitutions". I get it. But what happen to good old customer service... when I requested a menu item that I've gotten 4 times in the last 6 months, I was advised what I requested wasn't a option. His response insinuated I was making things up. This guy is trained well in what can't be done. Little disappointed in the service tonight. On the plus my Peach mule was tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

P7WxvwVuKIHZqQ8GMyzYag.text: A great historic place with cool atmosphere for food and drinks ! Excellent Burritos/ tacos  a large selection of beer and  outstanding house margaritas You can eat / drink at tables outside in the back or enjoy the bar in front / restaurant seating too . As a nice bonus they have a very large selection of exotic small batch Mescal available  I like to drink it  straight w no ice Like a fine whiskey Please  don't waste it by doing shots save that for cheap tequila A nice place Enjoy !

mdp0k2_MkpqqKTaBkFoipQ.text: Love the outdoor seating! It's a crowded place with good food, atmosphere, and drinks! Definitely a place to go in the evening on a summer night with friends. Can't wait to go back!

a0hgyOMl-rp0fI3N4imSTg.text: This place might seem small at first glance but it is quite large, and they have outdoor seating including  an outdoor bar at the rear of the building. The chips and salsa are very good - definitely get those! And definitely get a margarita too - it tasted great and the salt on the rim made it all the more perfect. Food wise the veggie burrito was good but the tofu taco was dry and unexciting. Service was decent. I'd come back here especially on a sunny day when the patio is open.

VkUPBP-l9vfL2e17ozrM-A.text: I am actually surprised at how much I enjoyed my time here this time. The last time I would say could only be described as, eh. This time I had fun, the food was good, and the drinks were affordable! All things that I think anyone would be looking for in a place. I will say that we went for happy hour and they were accommodating to 5 people with plenty of tables for us to pick and they had really fast service! FREE CHIPS AND SALSA!!   I was loving the $5 taco deal. You had your choice between, something, something, something else, and fish. I of course picked fish because it is what I am always drawn to. I don't even remember any of the other choices, because when you can pick fish why pick anything else?!  The plate for $5 came with two fish tacos. I will not say that these were the biggest tacos I have ever seen but they did fill me up without leaving me stuffed. I enjoyed them. AND THEY ARE SERVED WITH CORN TORTILLAS. Personal favorite.   I also got the $5 sangria. It came in a tall mason jar and hit the spot. It wasn't overly sweet and was topped with just a simple orange slice. I thought that was nice, more room for the booze and less room for fruit that would be hard to eat/get out of the jar.   So for about $10, not including tip I had a really fulfilling meal. What else would anyone want other than that!?   I will say the wait staff was super helpful and really nice. I was happy we picked Round Corner.

photos.caption: Photo of Round Corner Cantina - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brunch!
